intro: Galinsoga caracasana, commonly known as Spanish needle or gallant soldier, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into bristly, hair-tipped seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Galinsoga caracasana typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas and along roadsides. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
